Acronym Number of proposal(s) with this institution as a "Key Implementing Institution": Number of "Source of Monetary" using this institution: Delete Institution It appears that the institution you would like to delete is currently in used as a "Key Implementing Institution" or as a "Source of Monetary" by one or multiple proposal(s). If you want to delete this institution, you therefore need to select a replacing institution for the concerned proposal(s). Attention! The deletion of an instituion and its replacement can not be undone. Please be sure you want to delete this particular institution and, if applicable, you selected the right replacement institution. It is strongly recommended to operate daily backup of the database. Please contact your server administrator for more information. International Institution Institutions Location Name Replacement institution Type Public Private for profit Private for non-profit Private Individual Source Please select in this list your source of monetary and material support. If this one is not listed, please select "Other" at the bottom of this list. If this one is the same as your "Key Implementing Institution", please select "Key Implementing Institution" at the bottom of the list. Add source of monetary or material support Amount Please enter whole numbers without any comma or other separator. Key Implementing Institution The key implementing institution for the research. Please write any individual, organization, group or other legal entity responsible for overall management and implementation of research. If your key implementing institution is not listed in the above list, please provide the following information: If your source of monetary is not included in the above list, please provide the following information.
Please note that if this one has already been provided as an other institution for your key implementing institution, just select "Key Implementing Institution" in the bottom of the above list. Export of human tissue outside the country? Review Form Review Form Response Please click on the "speach bubble" icon to access the response of this reviewer to the review form. Click on icon to fill in the review form. Please fill in required fields. The Health Research Portal Are you sure you wish to mark this task as completed? You may not be able to make changes afterwards.

Mongolia Health Research Portal is an integrated online health research management system that offers substantial benefits for all stakeholders in health research. The Portal aims to improve accountability, efficiency and quality of health research conducted in Mongolia by providing information on all ongoing research and hence increasing transparency and by streamlining the ethics review process.

The Portal can be used to:

Submit research proposals for review to Mongolia MOH Ethics Review Committee 24x7 from anywhere. Researchers need to register on the Portal. Once registered, you will have a permanent account and be able to submit research proposal in a paper-less way and to track the review status of your proposals.

Search ongoing and completed health research from January 2014 onwards through a publically accessible research registry. No registration or log-in is required to search the ongoing research.

Access complete research reports for the researches started since 2014 once the research is completed. [Since the system has been launched only in January 2014, there are no research reports in the system at present, but will be added as and when a research is completed or over time]

Access information on all the applicable guidelines, rules, and regulations related to health research (being added…).

Access a “Researchers' Directory” containing information on the national and international researchers doing research in Mongolia (will be added soon...).

Keywords Type, method or approach Language Secretary Administrative Assistant Investigator comments Here is a comment of the submitter about this research proposal. Proposal Proposals Details Abstract Student Institution Academic Degree Primary Sponsor Funds Required Default Disable Enable Font Size Small Medium Large Title Scientific title Scientific title of the study as it appears in the protocol submitted for funding and ethical review. This title should contain information on population, intervention, comparator and outcome(s). Public title Title intended for the lay public in easily understood language. Abstract Objectives Keywords Key research questions, hypothesis, objectives in bullet points if feasible. Background Key issues under investigation, importance, what is known already, and why this study. Study Methods Relevant features of study design (qualitative/quantitative, cross-sectional survey/case-control...), estimated sample size, manner of data collection, etc. [e.g. study involves key informant interviews with policy-makers, involving 6-8 people at national or provincial level...] Expected outcomes and use of results Potential outcomes of study such as measurement of prevalence, other indicators being measured, how the results will be used to inform particular policy or program... Significant or descriptive words. Start date of the research. End date of the research. Please enter whole numbers without any comma or other separator. The individual, organization, group or other legal entity which takes responsibility for initiating, managing and/or financing a study. The Primary Sponsor is responsible for ensuring that the research is properly registered. The Primary Sponsor may or may not be the main funder. If your primary sponsor is not included in the above list, please specify it here. Additional individuals, organizations or other legal persons, if any, that have agreed with the primary sponsor to take on responsibilities of sponsorship. A secondary sponsor may have agreed: • to take on all the responsibilities of sponsorship jointly with the primary sponsor; or • to form a group with the primary sponsor in which the responsibilities of sponsorship are allocated among the members of the group; or • to act as the sponsor’s legal representative in relation to some or all of the trial sites; or • to take responsibility for the accuracy of trial registration information submitted. Is the research involving patients from different countries? Is the research undertaken as part of academic degree requirements? Institution where the student is enrolled. Please provide the full name and title of the supervisor of the student(s). Please provide the email of the supervisor of the student(s). Academic degree in which the student is enrolled. Undergraduate Master Post-Doc Ph.D. Geographical area(s) where the research take place. If one or more of your secondary sponsor(s) is/are not included in the above list, please sepcify it/them here. Short description of the primary purpose of the protocol, including a brief statement of the study hypothesis. Include publication/s details (link/reference), if any. Informed Consent Included? Data Collection Questionnaires Included? Ethical Clearance Enclosed? Proposal reviewed by other Committee If yes, other Committee Decision If yes, please specify: Proof Of Registration Included? Data Collection Source(s) of Monetary or Material Support Industry grant Ministry of Health grant Agency grant If yes, please specify: Government grant (non MoH) Please specify University research grant Self funding Other If yes, please specify: Risk Assessment Does the proposed research include research subjects: Whose identity may be revealed during the research process? Unable to consent? Under 18 years old? In a dependent relationship with any of the research team members? (e.g. a researcher is the treating physician of one of the research participants) From an ethnic minority group? With intellectual or mental impairment? Who are pregnant? Does the research include: A new treatment, medical procedure or test? Collection of biological samples including
tissue extraction? Use of ionizing radiation? Pain or psychological distress? Inducements? Collection of sensitive information? Deception? Assisted reproductive technology? Human genetic or genomic studies? Stem cell research? Biosafety issue? Potential risks Level of the risk involved in Research Minimal risk means that the probability and magnitude of harm or discomfort anticipated in the research are not greater in and of themselves than those ordinarily encountered in daily life or during the performance of routine physical or psychological examination or tests. No more than minimal risk Minor increase over minimal risk More than minor increase over minimal risk Briefly list the risks How are risks minimized / managed? Risks apply to Research Team Research Subjects Wider Community Nobody Potential Benefits Direct benefit to participants Generalizable knowledge about participants' condition or disorder Generalizable knowledge about disease or condition under study Benefits from the research project No benefits Multi-institution Project Conflict of Interest Does any member of the research team has any financial or technical conflict of interest in the proposed research (i.e. whether any member of the research team is likely to be affected, positively or negatively, by the outcomes of the research in financial or technical terms) Identity revealed Unable to consent Under 18 Dependent relationship Ethnic minority group Intellectual or mental impairment Pregnant New treatment Biological samples Radiation Distress Inducements Sensitive information Deception Reproductive technology Human genetic or genomic Stem cell Biosafety Risk level Risks apply to Benefits Multi-institutions Conflict of Interest Committee Decision and Review/ Review Status This is the last review status of the research proposal for this round of review. Proposal Status This is the main status of the research proposal. Active is how many reviews are currently being considered or underway. Click on file names to download and review (on screen or by printing) the files associated with this proposal. For more information, please click on the bubble icon to open a chat room between you and the secretary of your committee. Please upload the review of the proposal here. Select a recommendation and submit the review to complete the process. You must upload your review file before selecting a recommendation. No recommendation was selected. You must choose a recommendation to submit. Once you have recorded a decision you will no longer be able to make changes to this review. Are you sure you wish to continue?

To upload a proposal for review, complete the following steps.

  1. On this page, click Browse (or Choose File) which opens a Choose File window for locating the file on the hard drive of your computer.
  2. Locate the file you wish to submit and highlight it.
  3. Click Open on the Choose File window, which places the name of the file on this page.
  4. Click Upload on this page, which uploads the file from the computer to the web site and renames it following the Health Research Portal naming conventions.
  5. Once the proposal is uploaded, click Save and Continue at the bottom of this page.

Investigator Guidelines Submission Preparation Checklist As part of the proposal process, authors are required to check off their proposal's compliance with all of the following items, and proposals may be returned to authors that do not adhere to these guidelines. The proposal will not be reviewed until the payment arrives. Click PAY NOW above to see the payment instructions.
